intro: Drymaria weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's mouse-ear, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features basal leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape, covered in fine hairs. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Drymaria weberbaueri is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
